result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel P Gleason

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Defendant Daniel P Gleason in court.  Attorney Jonathan Bradley Lundeen in court for Daniel P Gleason.  Attorney Lucas D Arras in court for State of Wisconsin. B. Bahr - Clerk 
21CM254, 22CM296, 22FO765, 22FO766, 21CM265, 22CM190

Atty Lundeen - all matters are resolved. Provides plea documents to Court. 

State - plea to Ct 1 and Ct 2 of 21CM254. Plea to Ct 1 21CM265.  Will DRI remaining counts and DRI 22CM190, 22CM296. Wheld sent. 18 months probation on all counts. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow thru. Mental health  counseling if recommend by agent. No contact with K.H.G. dob: 5/15/80. Not enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns. Follow recommendations of agent. Restitution in 21CM254 of $171.75. Costs $463 all misd x 3. Ct 2 of 21cm254 will include drug abuse surcharge of $10. Jail credit of 2 days in each case if revoked. Victim rights have been complied with and would like to read a statement.

Atty Lundeen - that is the agreement. 22FO765 and 22FO766 - DRI
Victim - makes a statement to the court.
DE - enters NC plea to all Count 1 and 2 of 21CM254, and NC plea to Count 1 of 21CM265.
Court - provides plea colloquy
Parties stipulate to the facts
Court - finds waiver of rights voluntary plea free & knowing & approves stips to facts. Accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.
State - asks court to accept joint recommendation.  Atty Lundeen - agrees court should accept joint recommendation.

Court orders -
21CM254 - Count 1
Wheld sentence
18 months probation
Maintain absolute sobriety 
AODA and follow thru 
Mental health counseling if recommend by agent 
No contact with K.H.G. dob: 5/15/80 
Not enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns or any places where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Follow recommendations of agent
2 days jail credit if revoked
Costs of $463 

21CM254 - Count 2
Wheld sentence
18 months probation
Maintain absolute sobriety 
AODA and follow thru 
Mental health counseling if recommend by agent 
No contact with K.H.G. dob: 5/15/80 
Not enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns or any places where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Follow recommendations of agent
2 days jail credit if revoked
Restitution of $171.75
Costs of $473

21CM265 - Count 1
Wheld sentence
18 months probation
Maintain absolute sobriety
AODA and follow thru 
Mental health counseling if recommend by agent  
No contact with K.H.G. dob: 5/15/80
Not enter any bars, liquor stores or taverns or any places where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol
Follow recommendations of agent
2 days jail credit if revoked
Costs of $463

21CM254 - Count 3 - DRI
21CM265 - Counts 2, 3 - DRI
22CM190 - DRI
22CM296 - DRI
22FO765 - DRI
22FO766 - DRI
Initial appearance on October 7, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 4, 2022 at 10:55 am.
